name: Chicken Korma
history: Chicken Korma is a dish that originated from the Mughal era in India. It is known for its rich and creamy texture, a result of slow-cooking chicken in a mixture of spices, yogurt, and nuts.
description: Chicken Korma is a luxurious curry made with tender chicken pieces simmered in a creamy sauce. The sauce typically includes yogurt, ground nuts, and a blend of fragrant spices like cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves.

instructions.title: Marinate the Chicken
instructions.description: Mix the chicken pieces with yogurt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder. Marinate for at least 30 minutes or overnight.

instructions.title: Cook the Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves. Once they start to sizzle, add onions and ginger-garlic paste. Cook until the onions are golden.

instructions.title: Add the Chicken
instructions.description: Add the marinated chicken to the pan. Cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.

instructions.title: Simmer with Ground Almonds
instructions.description: Add ground almonds and water. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the chicken is tender and the sauce has thickened.

instructions.title: Finish with Cream and Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in cream and garam masala. Cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like naan or roti.

tips: Marinating the chicken for a longer period enhances the flavor.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to suit your spice tolerance.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or bell peppers for added nutrition and color.
For a nut-free version, omit the ground almonds and use coconut milk instead.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, topped with a swirl of cream or butter.
Pair with a tangy mint chutney or a side salad.
